text: <!channel>: I just sent an email, but so everyone is in the loop -- The latest word is that the covers won't pass inspection, so we need to scramble quickly to see if there are other possible options.
The Vera hub does say it supports Insteon devices
"the ability to bridge with virtually any control platform (Z-Wave, Insteon, Serial, X-10, etc.).  It’s also got more memory to run more apps.  Plus fast Wi-Fi!"
We used the veralite for Lumen. The only issue with it is that it gets overloaded with commands pretty quickly

"If you have a primarily Insteon network, I strongly recommend that you research the was the Vera works with Insteon. It is sort of a half implementation. Yes you can add Insteon devices once you buy and install a separate PLM, but the Vera only supports 1-way communication, so when you view your devices, they are never shown to be set as they are in reality. Also, Vera based scenes on Insteon devices update one light at a time, which feels like a throw-back to the days of X10. You will quickly find that most people using this thing with Insteon are using an alternate operating system called Altsteon which requires some moderately deep computing skills to install and use, and even then does not currently work with all your Insteon devices, or X10 for that matter. This thing seems to be primarily a Z-Wave-centric controller, that can also control a few Insteon lights if you have them laying around. DO NOT expect to drop this onto a pure Insteon network and be happy with the result."
^Comment on the Vera Control hub here: <http://www.smarthome.com/13705/Vera-Control-LTD-VeraLite-INSTEON-Compatible-Z-Wave-Controller/p.aspx>

attachments.text: Vera Control is offering home control that is affordable for everyone, with their new VeraLite, Z-Wave controller. Featuring a faster processor and more memory for downloading apps, Vera3 is more powerful than ever! B007005364

upshot being that if we decided to go all zwave on devices, we wouldn't have to rearchitect the hub
downshot: many
For those interested: <https://github.com/jperkin/node-openzwave>

attachments.title: ZBLC15 – Model #4033A
attachments.text: ZigBee HA Dual-Relay Controller Monitor and control two devices such as overhead lights, ceiling fans, and small appliances plugged into power outlets or controlled by wall switches, with a controller that can be hidden anywhere, even in standard single-gang boxes.  Save money by eliminating idle power drawn by devices that are off or on standby mode.  Independently control 2 devices, based on your commands from phone tablet or web browser, or the state of  other devices or events in your system. Smart Possibilities Eliminate idle power drawn by devices that are off or on standby Trigger lights based on motion Turn on ceiling fans in response to temperature readings Use your lights to make it look like you're home when you're away
